sausage.desc: Shoots a chain of sausage-shaped explosions that go through terrain and are effected by gravity, similar to Rainbow.

content: If Sausage is fired with less than 35 power, the first explosion may hit the user. (Needs to be verified for higher tiers)

bratwurst.desc: Similar to the first tier, but the sausages are smaller, making it easier to do more damage.

content: If Sausage is fired with less than 35 power, the first explosion may hit the user. (Needs to be verified for higher tiers)

kielbasa.desc: Again similar to the first tier, but the sausages are even smaller.

content: If Sausage is fired with less than 35 power, the first explosion may hit the user. (Needs to be verified for higher tiers)

jackpot.desc:
Increases in damage at a rate of 25 damage per second in the air, if the number exceeds 100, it will deal 1 damage. Jackpot's color is a light-green with yellow sparkles.
To achieve maximum damage, aim with no more than 77 power if the target is exactly level with you and within 150% of your aiming diameter.

content: If you are at the same elevation as your target enemy tank. You can shoot at 100 power at a high angle with Lottery and deal 118-129 damage. For the most part, if you want to achieve maximum damage with Lottery, you have to be at a higher elevation than your target tank.

mega_jackpot.desc:
The damage increases at the same rate as Jackpot, however, if the number exceeds 110, it will deal 1 damage. Mega-jackpot's color is green with green sparkles.
If your target is level and close, aim with no more than 85 power.

content: If you are at the same elevation as your target enemy tank. You can shoot at 100 power at a high angle with Lottery and deal 118-129 damage. For the most part, if you want to achieve maximum damage with Lottery, you have to be at a higher elevation than your target tank.

ultra_jackpot.desc:
The damage increases at the same rate as Jackpot, however, if the number exceeds 120, it will deal 1 damage. Ultra-jackpot's color is turquoise with blue sparkles.
If your target is level and close, aim with no more than 92 power. You can use 93 power as long as your target is exactly level or at the slightest higher elevation to you.

content: If you are at the same elevation as your target enemy tank. You can shoot at 100 power at a high angle with Lottery and deal 118-129 damage. For the most part, if you want to achieve maximum damage with Lottery, you have to be at a higher elevation than your target tank.

lottery.desc: The damage increases at the same rate as Jackpot, however, if the number exceeds 130 it will deal only 1 damage. Lottery's color is light-green with purple sparkles. At equal elevation, you can fire this with full power.

content: If you are at the same elevation as your target enemy tank. You can shoot at 100 power at a high angle with Lottery and deal 118-129 damage. For the most part, if you want to achieve maximum damage with Lottery, you have to be at a higher elevation than your target tank.

early_bird.desc: Early bird is one of the few weapons that seem normal but actually is not. The weapon shoots a shot that automatically explodes after a very short time. The time is short enough that even when shot at 100 power, the shot is unable to make it beyond the length of the firing circle. The shot will also explode if it hits an enemy before the timer expires, making this an excellent short range weapon.

content: Early Bird hits at a distance of approximately the length of a full power bar when fired at 100 power, and Early Worm will hit at approximately 1.5 times the length of a full power bar.

early_worm.desc: Behaves exactly like Early Bird with an increased timer. Damage remains untouched and the shot still explodes prematurely on contact with terrain or enemy tanks.

content: Early Bird hits at a distance of approximately the length of a full power bar when fired at 100 power, and Early Worm will hit at approximately 1.5 times the length of a full power bar.

recruiter.desc: A green flare is shot like normal. When it comes to a rest, blue shots will come in from both sides of the screen, hitting mostly in the place where the flare landed.

enroller.desc: Behaves just like Recruiter, except the projectiles are now green and 3 more shots are fired.

enlister.desc: Like Enroller, but changes the color to a darker green and adds 3 more shots for a grand total of 20.

fury.desc: A shot is fired like normal. When it hits the ground, it rises straight up into the air and proceeds to rain down a barrage of tiny fireball-like projectiles. The projectiles do not leave fire and explode upon impact.

content: This weapon activates when it hits the ground, not a tank, friend or foe. Be aware of this so that your shot does not travel through a tank and land in an unintended place.

rage.desc: Similar to Fury, but adds an extra "fury projectile" that's blue, rises higher and also drops larger pellets below where it rises. However, it doesn't last as long as the other projectile does.

stats.Damage per Projectile:
5 per orange projectile
10 per blue projectile

content: This weapon activates when it hits the ground, not a tank, friend or foe. Be aware of this so that your shot does not travel through a tank and land in an unintended place.

relocator.desc: A normal shot is fired. Upon landing, a red circle is outlined. This weapon will teleport anything in its radius, but it will only deal damage to enemy tanks

displacement_bomb.desc: Similarly to Relocator, the weapon will teleport anything in it's radius, with the same damage, only the AoE is doubled and the color changes to blue.

imploder.desc: The user starts to charge itself, building up tremendous energy until it creates a massive explosion dealing damage to themselves and the other players in the vicinity. The ally and self-damage is around half of the user's health before firing. Enemies, however, receive 200 damage no matter how much self-damage the user gets.

content: This weapon cannot kill the user with the self-damage it causes. No matter how much self-damage you get from it, you will always stay alive with at least 1 hp (meaning you get 0 self-damage if you're already at 1hp).
If a shield is used, all self damage is fully mitigated

If you get teleported somewhere else while using an imploder via a Relocator or its upgrade, the explosion will happen where you were teleported to. This is different from most other weapons, where you will continue to fire the shot were you were before you got teleported. Be aware of this as a high level player could teleport you into your teammates while using imploder.

ultimate_imploder.desc: The Ultimate Imploder doesn't change the damage values, but it creates a bigger explosion for bigger destruction.

content: This weapon cannot kill the user with the self-damage it causes. No matter how much self-damage you get from it, you will always stay alive with at least 1 hp (meaning you get 0 self-damage if you're already at 1hp).
If a shield is used, all self damage is fully mitigated

If you get teleported somewhere else while using an imploder via a Relocator or its upgrade, the explosion will happen where you were teleported to. This is different from most other weapons, where you will continue to fire the shot were you were before you got teleported. Be aware of this as a high level player could teleport you into your teammates while using imploder.

stone.desc: Stone acts similar to bounsplode, but does not damage terrain while bouncing and deals less and less damage as it bounces. After the last bounce, the stone explodes upon hitting the ground, leaving a small hole and doing damage. A great starting weapon against enemies in small holes or on flat land.

boulder.desc: Boulder is the same as stone, but adds in more bounces. The boulder is also bigger than stone.

fireball.desc: Not exactly a fireball that is seen in comics or movies. It is instead a large molten boulder that is burning with flames. Same as stone, it bounces and deals damage, except it leaves behind fire particles every time it does so, dealing additional damage. It has many more bounces as well, allowing larger damage outputs. An excellent weapon for enemies in small holes or on flat land at close range.

cat.desc: A simple first tier weapon, a large cat will fly and explode on the ground upon impact, dealing a solid 40 damage and leaving a crater as big as a grenade would create.

content: Cats and Dogs was formerly the highest damage weapon in the game, it used to deal 16x22, firing enormous 32U projectiles. When the game moved to steam, this weapon was nerfed so excessively, that most high level players refuse to use the weapon.
The number of cats and dogs is completely random, sometimes resulting in a rare occurrence where only one animal is rained down with the other animal entirely absent from the weapon's effect.
Similar to Synclets and Needler, Kitten's spread is caused by the shots having a varied power.

kittens.desc: You know what's more adorable that a cat? kittens. Do you know what's better? 10 kittens. The 2nd Tier of cats will make you shoot 10 small kittens in a Rapid Fire fashion. Depending on the distance they can deal 5 to 12 damage. Due to their smaller size, the kittens all have a smaller blast radius when compared to Cat.

content: Cats and Dogs was formerly the highest damage weapon in the game, it used to deal 16x22, firing enormous 32U projectiles. When the game moved to steam, this weapon was nerfed so excessively, that most high level players refuse to use the weapon.
The number of cats and dogs is completely random, sometimes resulting in a rare occurrence where only one animal is rained down with the other animal entirely absent from the weapon's effect.
Similar to Synclets and Needler, Kitten's spread is caused by the shots having a varied power.

super_cat.desc: Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No, its Super Cat! The third tier that require 3,100xp resembles the first tier mentioned earlier, but more powerful. It deals 55 damage and has a bigger blast radius. True to its name, it is also seen wearing a red cape.

content: Cats and Dogs was formerly the highest damage weapon in the game, it used to deal 16x22, firing enormous 32U projectiles. When the game moved to steam, this weapon was nerfed so excessively, that most high level players refuse to use the weapon.
The number of cats and dogs is completely random, sometimes resulting in a rare occurrence where only one animal is rained down with the other animal entirely absent from the weapon's effect.
Similar to Synclets and Needler, Kitten's spread is caused by the shots having a varied power.

cats_and_dogs.desc: Unlike the previous variants, Cats and Dogs shoots a flare, rather than a direct impact shot.  If you're wondering why the flare is a dog bone, that is because there are dogs in this tier. Soon after the flare lands, it literally starts raining cats and dogs. The damage and blast radius varies depending on the size of the animal that hit the enemy.

content: Cats and Dogs was formerly the highest damage weapon in the game, it used to deal 16x22, firing enormous 32U projectiles. When the game moved to steam, this weapon was nerfed so excessively, that most high level players refuse to use the weapon.
The number of cats and dogs is completely random, sometimes resulting in a rare occurrence where only one animal is rained down with the other animal entirely absent from the weapon's effect.
Similar to Synclets and Needler, Kitten's spread is caused by the shots having a varied power.

ghost_bomb.desc: Ghost Bomb shoots a single projectile that has a fairly large explosion radius. Although not as powerful as Nuke, Ghost Bomb can serve as an alternative for players who are yet to unlock Nuke. Ghost Bomb also does not damage terrain, making it useful for hitting multiple enemies while keeping your aim on them.

ghostlets.desc: Ghostlets shoots 5 smaller ghosts that have both decreased damage and splash radius. Ghostlets can be used to hit a large area on the map, or can be concentrated against a single target for increased total damage.

flasher.desc: A single projectile is shot. Upon landing, 14 bright explosions happen rapidly one after the other, starting from the shot's impact point. The explosions increase in size as they manifest, letting some misses do minor damage.

strobie.desc: Strobie is the same as Flasher, but has more explosions, and results in a larger radius. Strobie adds 4 blasts, resulting in 18 total explosions.

rave.desc: Rave is the same as the its younger brothers, but has even more explosions, and thus, an even larger radius. Rave adds 4 more explosions, making it a total of 22 explosions.

sprouter.desc: Shoots a shot like normal. When the shot hits the terrain, 4 equally spaced projectiles will fly out from both sides and explode when coming back down to the ground. The projectiles are subject to wind, so be mindful. This weapon works best on flat land or small hills.

stats.Explosion Radius:
Initial Shot: 4 (10 PU)
Green projectiles: 6 (15 PU)

content: If the Sprouter or Blossom is placed against a back wall, all projectiles that spawn on the back wall side will spawn right next to the back wall instead of spawning outside of the map. This can be used to dig someone on the edge of the map into a deep pit and/or deal large amounts of damage to a player. This can sometimes even make it nearly impossible for a player to shoot very far out of the pit.

blossom.desc: Works like sprouter, but once the projectiles reach the top of their arc, a second wave of projectiles emerge from the first wave, allowing more damage output and further travel in wind, if that is what the player wants to do.

stats.Explosion Radius:
Initial Shot: 4 (10 PU)
Green projectiles: 6 (15 PU)
Yellow projectiles: 8 (20 PU)

content: If the Sprouter or Blossom is placed against a back wall, all projectiles that spawn on the back wall side will spawn right next to the back wall instead of spawning outside of the map. This can be used to dig someone on the edge of the map into a deep pit and/or deal large amounts of damage to a player. This can sometimes even make it nearly impossible for a player to shoot very far out of the pit.

square.desc: Fires a "square" that airbursts into four seperate fragments, each fragment dealing 30 damage. Fragments will fly in the direction the piece is facing when the shot bursts.

hexagon.desc: Same as the above, but with a 6 piece hexagon.

octagon.desc: Same as the above, but with an 8 piece octagon. Assuming Octagon bursts above a flat surface, it will deal damage in a large area.

wacky_cluster.desc: Shoots a shot, splitter, breaker, and a One-Bounce at once at reduced damage values. Best when used at close range.

kooky_cluster.desc: Same as wacky cluster, but adds a roller as well.

stats.Explosion Radius: Shot: 11 (27.5 PU)Breaker: 2\*11(27.5 PU)Splitter: 2\*11(27.5 PU)One-Bounce: 11 (27.5 PU)Roller: 7 (17.5 PU)

crazy_cluster.desc: Same as kooky cluster, but adds a digger into the mix.

satellite.desc: A flare based weapon that creates a vertical beam and damages any player in radius by 50 damage. It has approximately the same radius as Big Shot.

content: Although this weapon creates a tall vertical beam, a flare placed too far beneath an enemy tank will not do damage, even if the tank is in the beam.

ufo.desc: Almost identical with the tier 1, except one major difference, the radius is greatly increased while still dealing 50 damage. It has approximately the same radius as Massive Shot.

content: Although this weapon creates a tall vertical beam, a flare placed too far beneath an enemy tank will not do damage, even if the tank is in the beam.

palm.desc: A shot is shot like normal. When it hits the ground, it rises straight up in the air, influenced by wind. After rising a bit, the projectile spits into 5, one going straight down and 2 going off towards the sides on both sides, giving it the appearance of a palm tree.

content: If the palm "tree" rises into a bumper that halts its vertical movement, it will immediately split into its damaging projectiles.
If a tree hits land while it is rising, it will disappear and will not split into its damaging projectiles.

double_palm.desc: Shoots the shot like normal. Upon impact, the projectile splits into two that jump off to the side and then splits like normal.

content: If the palm "tree" rises into a bumper that halts its vertical movement, it will immediately split into its damaging projectiles.
If a tree hits land while it is rising, it will disappear and will not split into its damaging projectiles.

triple_palm.desc: Similar to double palm, but adds in the middle "tree", resulting in something that looks just like the weapon icon.

content: If the palm "tree" rises into a bumper that halts its vertical movement, it will immediately split into its damaging projectiles.
If a tree hits land while it is rising, it will disappear and will not split into its damaging projectiles.

shockshell.desc: Perhaps the most obvious wordplay, ShockShell is a great weapon. It is almost a guaranteed 35 damage, depending on who is in the way. When shot at a high power it can do an arcing short distance jump, during which it can be influenced by x2, targets etc. and can even jump above players. As soon as it hits the ground it goes on to infinity and beyond until it either hits a tank. An enemy tank stops it and takes damage, while friendly tanks do not, even though it also stops the shell. If there are no alive tanks in the way, the shell simply glides out of the map. Because of its infinite lifespan on the ground, it will pass through any bumpers in the way as well. Firing at 90 degrees doesn't lead you anywhere, as well as firing too steeply into the ground. The weapon will only deal damage to you if it hits an enemy standing right next to you, so even firing with 0 power is safe. If an enemy is at 35 health or lower, or hiding behind a bumper, shock him with this shell.

content: The ShockShell will be absorbed by a black hole if its path is obstructed by the center of a black hole.

Although it is extremely hard to do, it is possible to block a ShockShell using a weapon that builds land. One would have to time their shot to land exactly where a ShockShell fired from their opponent would be by the time their projectile gets there. On top of this you would have to know your opponent is firing a ShockShell.
if you shoot a friend with ShockShell, the shell will just disappear without doing any damage.

shockshell_trio.desc: For those who think one shell is not enough, this weapon shoots 3 shells instead of 1! They have reduced damage, but deal more total damage. Since there are 3 shells, you can destroy an enemy with one shell and have the rest hit more enemies.

content: The ShockShell will be absorbed by a black hole if its path is obstructed by the center of a black hole.

Although it is extremely hard to do, it is possible to block a ShockShell using a weapon that builds land. One would have to time their shot to land exactly where a ShockShell fired from their opponent would be by the time their projectile gets there. On top of this you would have to know your opponent is firing a ShockShell.
if you shoot a friend with ShockShell, the shell will just disappear without doing any damage.

fountain.desc: This weapon will create a simple, one-level high fountain on demand. As pretty as it looks, it's unadvisable for tanks to get near it.

content: Proper sprinkler placement for maximized damage against a single target.

waterworks.desc: You say that one-level is not enough? Well then here, have a double. This upgraded fountain is a true masterpiece, and will shoot a small and a big fountain stimultaneously! For a slighty decrease in power, but that's a small price to pay for such a show!

content: Proper sprinkler placement for maximized damage against a single target.

sprinkler.desc: It's summer again, and these nasty tanks keep destroying your lawn? Never fear! Simply set up this sprinkler and it will take good care of anyone in its close vicinity. Upon landing on the ground, Sprinkler will spray water in a 180 degrees spread in a preset pattern. Sprinkler goes around 3 times with the water spraying in the same spots every time. Setting it up on a hill can maximize effectiveness, spreading water over a large area. Let those tanks know where their place is!

content: Proper sprinkler placement for maximized damage against a single target.

flattener.desc: Fires a somewhat large bullet that when landing, flattens the terrain in the same radius as Sinkhole and a depth of around one digger deep. If shot into a hole it will flatten all terrain in its area of effect, no matter what height. If shot from the bottom of a cliff to the top, it will raise terrain equal to the landing spot to "flatten" the terrain around it. This is a useful tactic of raising oneself when stuck in a hole. Unlike other weapons, its damage is calculated after moving terrain.

wall.desc: Creates a wall around four times the height of the players tank. The area of effect for damage is any enemy directly hit and a small area around the created wall. Its AI is the same as Bulger in that if it lands in a hole, it raises terrain equally across the affected area.

fortress.desc: Fortress creates 2 mini walls off to the sides of the shot's landing spot with the Bulger AI. It does not, however, flatten terrain in the center, but will deal damage to anything caught near the blast.

funnel.desc: When shot, Funnel creates something that exactly resembles its weapon icon by raising terrain on triangles that cutoff at their peaks. Sillyballs are then dropped into the funnel with most ending up at the bottom of the funnel. Damage is distance based and is more effective on direct hits.

chicken_fling.desc: Fires three drumsticks that have various degrees of spread. The spread is random each shot, so there is no absolute good way of shooting this weapon except for blasting close range opponents that are within a direct line of sight at 100 power. Damage is heavily distance based, so hitting some long range hits is better than hitting all shots at close range.

content: Similarly to Synclets and Needler, this weapon's spread is caused by each shot having a varied power.

chicken_hurl.desc: More chicken! Works just like chicken-fling, but adds in an extra drumstick. Unlike most weapons, damage is unaffected!

content: Similarly to Synclets and Needler, this weapon's spread is caused by each shot having a varied power.

chicken_launch.desc: The most chicken kChamp is willing to give us. Fires five drumsticks at the same exact damage as before.

content: Similarly to Synclets and Needler, this weapon's spread is caused by each shot having a varied power.

mad_birds.desc: Unleashes a red bird. It deals a decent 40 damage to enemies with a small damage radius, letting near misses do damage as well. It should be noted that all birds only do damage on the first hit with the ground. Afterwards, the bird will bounce and hit the ground a second time. This is only for show, and does nothing.

furious_birds.desc: The Furious Birds deepen the Angry Birds reference by adding its second type of bird: the blue bird. First the weapon fires a red bird that has its damage reduced to 30, following up with the blue bird that, just like in Angry Birds, splits into 3. One projectile goes directly where you shoot and the other 2 split equally to the left and right. They each deal 15 damage. The best way to fire this weapon is at a close distance and about 45 degrees. This way all projectiles hit and deal a significant amount of damage.

livid_birds.desc: The Livid Birds add the most destructive bird of the game they imitate: the yellow bird. The weapon fires a red bird that had its damage reduced to 20, then the blue bird, that now only does 10 per projectile and then the yellow bird that deals 40 damage. As a being of pure hate the yellow bird accelerates shortly before impact, which may lead to it missing where your other birds hit. Because of this and for the same reason as the Furious Birds a short range attack with about 45 degrees is the best way to go about things, since this is the best way to hit all the birds, which is necessary, because the guaranteed hits are only the red and 1 blue bird otherwise, which would only deal 30 damage.

pepper.desc: This weapon sends 10 peppers into your enemy, dealing 3 damage each and leaving a small hole on its impact, making it one of the smallest projectiles that can destroy terrain.

salt_and_pepper.desc: The 2nd tier adds a second burst of projectiles (assumed to be salt) that do 2 damage each and has noticeably more spread than the pepper wave.

paprika.desc: Paprika reverts back to firing only one burst of projectiles like Pepper, but deals more damage, even surpassing the double burst of Salt and Pepper.

cayenne.desc: The spice projectiles are now so spicy that enemies will feel the burn quite literally. Unlike other weapons in the Pepper family, the projectiles from this weapon act similar to Flame, doing damage over time and does not damage the terrain.

needler.desc: The Needler sprays 15 pink needles all over the place and after some delay explode one after another. They need to be directly next to or on an enemy to do damage. The weapon damage scales along with distance; its minimum damage is low enough to chunk tank health at close range, while its maximum damage and spread is high enough to make it a viable mid-range weapon.

content: On average, a Needler can be expected to be a reliable 100 damage weapon.

It rewards long distance shots with 10 damage per projectile, leading to a potential 150 damage. The payoff for close range is hitting with all projectiles, doing far less damage but doing at least 75 damage with reliability.

The Needler is great in all situations and excels at spraying down on a group of enemies long range as well as mid range shots, since the highest damage lies in the sweet spot of far enough for extra damage and close enough to be accurate.

To minimize the spread of Needler/Dual Needler you want to shoot at an angle that is closer to 0. The reason for this is because Needler varies in power when shot rather than angle. This makes 45-degree angle shots ineffective at minimizing spread. Shooting with a weapon that varies in power at 45 degrees will actually cause it to spread out the most. At more horizontal angles the spread is minimized because changes in power change less in the trajectory. (This can be tested by firing straight up in the firing range. If you fire a spread weapon straight up and it comes straight back down it only varies in power.)
Using a minimized spread at a range of about 1 aim-circle with Dual Needler you can usually ensure around 180+ damage with a max gun.

It is also possible to hit all projectiles over a very long range using portals. If you are moved over a very long distance (by either, hitting a teleport box or being hit by a relocator) you will also be able to get 10 damage per projectile.
This weapon penetrates shields.

dual_needler.desc: Going akimbo for more projectiles is always the way to go. Dual Needler adds 5 projectiles, increasing the minimum damage from 60 to 80 and the maximum damage from 150 to 200. The mid range sweetspot mentioned before makes this weapon a devastating choice.

content: On average, a Needler can be expected to be a reliable 100 damage weapon.

It rewards long distance shots with 10 damage per projectile, leading to a potential 150 damage. The payoff for close range is hitting with all projectiles, doing far less damage but doing at least 75 damage with reliability.

The Needler is great in all situations and excels at spraying down on a group of enemies long range as well as mid range shots, since the highest damage lies in the sweet spot of far enough for extra damage and close enough to be accurate.

To minimize the spread of Needler/Dual Needler you want to shoot at an angle that is closer to 0. The reason for this is because Needler varies in power when shot rather than angle. This makes 45-degree angle shots ineffective at minimizing spread. Shooting with a weapon that varies in power at 45 degrees will actually cause it to spread out the most. At more horizontal angles the spread is minimized because changes in power change less in the trajectory. (This can be tested by firing straight up in the firing range. If you fire a spread weapon straight up and it comes straight back down it only varies in power.)
Using a minimized spread at a range of about 1 aim-circle with Dual Needler you can usually ensure around 180+ damage with a max gun.

It is also possible to hit all projectiles over a very long range using portals. If you are moved over a very long distance (by either, hitting a teleport box or being hit by a relocator) you will also be able to get 10 damage per projectile.
This weapon penetrates shields.

beacon.desc: Beacon acts as a flare when shot. When it rests, it explodes, dealing damage. A bunch of smaller projectiles fly outwards, bounded by two invisible barriers that apply only to the beacon's projectiles, dealing more damage as they come down. As the two barriers are both very close to where the initial shot landed, it is highly recommended to land a direct hit with beacon. Note, should the tiny projectiles go through a portal, the barriers will not apply and the projectiles will fly away like normal.

beaconator.desc: Acts just like beacon, except a larger projectile is launched straight up in the air with the smaller projectiles and has a slightly bigger explosion radius.

stats.Damage per Projectile:
20 - Beacon
8 - Little projectiles
8 or 15 Big projectiles

kernels.desc: Shoots a bunch of popcorn kernels that act like flares. When they come to a rest, they will damage tanks that are on top of the kernels. Damage is distance based.

popcorn.desc: Similar to kernels, but the kernels actually pops into popcorn! The popcorn will pop and fly upwards a little before coming back down and damaging enemies. The AOE of this weapon varies, but as long as the kernels land somewhere near your target, you have a good chance of hitting them.

burnt_popcorn.desc: Works just like popcorn, but has the popcorn pop while on fire. Does slightly more damage than popcorn.

chopper.desc: Fires a helicopter into the air, and targets the nearest tank relative to itself. It fires at it while moving slowly through the air.

content: This weapon is doubly affected by wind.
The higher the angle of the shot, the longer this weapon stays in the air, and the longer this weapon stays in the air, the more projectiles it fires.
Similarly to weapons like Fighter Jet and Seagull, this weapon is most optimally fired such that the helicopter lands on an enemy tank, dealing extra damage aside from its projectiles.

apache.desc: Fires a larger helicopter that fires higher damage shots and causes a larger explosion.

content: This weapon is doubly affected by wind.
The higher the angle of the shot, the longer this weapon stays in the air, and the longer this weapon stays in the air, the more projectiles it fires.
Similarly to weapons like Fighter Jet and Seagull, this weapon is most optimally fired such that the helicopter lands on an enemy tank, dealing extra damage aside from its projectiles.

flintlock.desc: A ground piercing spray of bullets, if used right it can deal enormous damage.

content: When shot at a downward angle it is possible to hit a single tank with several projectiles.

blunderbuss.desc: Similar to flintlock with more bullets fired

content: When shot at a downward angle it is possible to hit a single tank with several projectiles.

skullshot.desc: Skullshot shoots a skull and crossbones projectile that splits in the air, splitting into a skull and 2 bones. There is a bit of spread when used long range.

content: The splitting ability only activates on the top of an arc. If shot at an angle less than 1 degree, there is no arc apex and the splitting does not activate. This trait is shared among all other weapons that use the arc apex to activate their effects.

skeleton.desc: Splits into a skull and 6 bones, allowing more damage output.

content: The splitting ability only activates on the top of an arc. If shot at an angle less than 1 degree, there is no arc apex and the splitting does not activate. This trait is shared among all other weapons that use the arc apex to activate their effects.

pinpoint.desc: Most of the flare types weapons you've seen deal area damage, this is the complete opposite of them, where the flare ball stops is where the damage will take place specifically. 15 "pins" will rain down from the sky in a almost straight line. Each pin deals 4 damage and does not break the terrain. Be careful of the wind because it can nudge them away from where they should land.

content: If you look carefully, you can see that the attack actually drops in 3 separate lines.
This weapon penetrates shields.

The projectiles spawned by this weapon do not explode when they hit tanks directly, they only explode on contact with the ground. If you try to hit a player that is on a wall with this weapon, the projectiles could go through their tank and hit the ground further beneath them, resulting in 0 damage.

It appears that when pinpoint's projectile hits a tank, it disappears and creates an explosion on the ground directly below the projectile, whether or not that part of the ground is touching the tank it hits.

needles.desc: An upgrade of pinpoint, it has a slightly larger AOE on the "needles" compared to the pins. It also has more projectiles.

content: If you look carefully, you can see that the attack actually drops in 3 separate lines.
This weapon penetrates shields.

The projectiles spawned by this weapon do not explode when they hit tanks directly, they only explode on contact with the ground. If you try to hit a player that is on a wall with this weapon, the projectiles could go through their tank and hit the ground further beneath them, resulting in 0 damage.

It appears that when pinpoint's projectile hits a tank, it disappears and creates an explosion on the ground directly below the projectile, whether or not that part of the ground is touching the tank it hits.

pins_and_needles.desc: The final upgrade of this weapon series, it packs a mighty punch firing a large amount of both pins and needles. They are identical in stats however, so the "pins and needles" skin is entirely vanity.

content: If you look carefully, you can see that the attack actually drops in 3 separate lines.
This weapon penetrates shields.

The projectiles spawned by this weapon do not explode when they hit tanks directly, they only explode on contact with the ground. If you try to hit a player that is on a wall with this weapon, the projectiles could go through their tank and hit the ground further beneath them, resulting in 0 damage.

It appears that when pinpoint's projectile hits a tank, it disappears and creates an explosion on the ground directly below the projectile, whether or not that part of the ground is touching the tank it hits.

fat_stacks.desc: Fat stacks shoots several dollar bills in a straight line towards the angle you are aimed at. After a bit, depending on your power, the bills will drop straight down, damaging enemies. If the bills hit someone before this process, they will take damage. The dollar bills have to hit terrain in order to do damage to yourself, but can hit enemy tanks directly tanks.

content: The projectiles travel straight for a distance of approximately three times the length of the Power bar of the shot, before falling straight down (in 0 Wind).

A bug exists for all upgrades for Fat Stacks and is seen when shooting the weapon at 0 power when there is no wind. When done so, the dollar bills stay stationary at the end of the tank's barrel until the projectiles despawn or collide with something.
The bug with firing this weapon at 0 power can be utilized with wind in order to hit someone at the same altitude as you.

If this weapon is shot at 0 degrees or lower, the dollar bills don't fall down and instead goes straight back to the shooter, resulting in the shooter damaging themselves unless they happen to be on the top of a hill.

A way to counteract the 0 power bug is by using a weapon that builds land. If a teammate or enemy tank shoots a weapon that build land into the projectiles, the projectiles will collide with the land causing them to disappear. Predicting when someone will do this will be easier as a teammate. Otherwise, you will just have to wait until the projectiles despawn.
Shooting as close to 0 angle as possible will minimize the spread of this weapon. The range of this weapon is just under half the map.
This weapon's damage is distance based.
Because the higher tiers of this weapon have a lower damage cap per projectile, the higher tiers are more effective from a closer range than their prior tiers.

dolla_bills.desc: Shoots more projectiles with a slightly smaller damage cap.

content: The projectiles travel straight for a distance of approximately three times the length of the Power bar of the shot, before falling straight down (in 0 Wind).

A bug exists for all upgrades for Fat Stacks and is seen when shooting the weapon at 0 power when there is no wind. When done so, the dollar bills stay stationary at the end of the tank's barrel until the projectiles despawn or collide with something.

make_it_rain.desc: Shoots more projectiles than its previous tier with a slightly smaller damage cap.

god_rays.desc: Let the rays from heaven blow your enemies away into nonexistence with this heavenly weapon. With 36 projectiles coming from 3 different rays of light(12 per) all dealing 6 damage each, it is truly a sight to see. If you manage to land every single shot you end up with 216 damage.

content: Before update v9.8.4, the Dev Destroyer achievement was only obtained by defeating kChamp in a game, making God Rays one of the rarest weapons in the game.
As of update v9.8.4, God Rays can also be obtained by defeating Lvl 100's that have them. However, if the player leaves before game ends, God Rays will not be awarded
Because of how this weapon's projectiles spawn, if the flare lands next to a steep cliff or in a deep hole, many of the projectiles will spawn in the ground or be blocked by the terrain.

Similarly to Pinpoint and Rain, this weapon's projectiles disappear when they come into contact with a tank, creating an explosion on the ground directly beneath where the projectile disappeared. As a result, if a tank is on a wall and is not touching any of the ground directly beneath them, this weapon's projectiles will almost never hit them.

deity.desc: If you think God Rays is a sight of pure beauty, wait until someone fires Deity.  Instead of 3 rays, Deity has 5 rays, almost covering half of the screen.  Coming with the 5 rays is 60 projectiles(5 Damage Each).  If you somehow land all of these shots it can deal 300 damage!

content: Before update v9.8.4, the Dev Destroyer achievement was only obtained by defeating kChamp in a game, making God Rays one of the rarest weapons in the game.
As of update v9.8.4, God Rays can also be obtained by defeating Lvl 100's that have them. However, if the player leaves before game ends, God Rays will not be awarded
Because of how this weapon's projectiles spawn, if the flare lands next to a steep cliff or in a deep hole, many of the projectiles will spawn in the ground or be blocked by the terrain.

Similarly to Pinpoint and Rain, this weapon's projectiles disappear when they come into contact with a tank, creating an explosion on the ground directly beneath where the projectile disappeared. As a result, if a tank is on a wall and is not touching any of the ground directly beneath them, this weapon's projectiles will almost never hit them.

hidden_blade.desc: For starters you will use something simple. This may be small, but it's more than enough to do damage in a decent area without leaving a trace. Use it wisely.

content: The hitbox for the hidden blade series is deceptively large, and is able to hit enemies a decent distance away.

secret_blade.desc: Now that you have some training, you're ready to step up. Use this to further expand on your assassination skills. And remember, not a trace.

content: The hitbox for the hidden blade series is deceptively large, and is able to hit enemies a decent distance away.

concealed_blade.desc: You are ready. Take this concealed blade and wield it wisely. no foe shall now stand in your path, and nobody will ever know what happened to those who do. Take good care, and do not let this power overcome you.

content: The hitbox for the hidden blade series is deceptively large, and is able to hit enemies a decent distance away.

portal_gun.desc: This weapon creates portal 2 portals (Right above where it lands and another one higher than the first one) then spawns a Companion Cube in between to travel in and out of the two portal creating its speed. After some time, the two portals dissolve and the accelerating cube smashes into the ground, dealing damage.

content: ASHPD means Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device. It is the "official" name for the portal gun in the Portal series.
If the player looks closely, the portals do not float in the air and are in fact slowly falling when spawned
This weapon can hit a 2x damage buff that is above where the weapon lands.

ashpd.desc: Much like the first tier, it sends two portals for a cube to traverse in, except the gap between the two portals is much bigger, giving the cube more time to speed up and deal more damage.

content: ASHPD means Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device. It is the "official" name for the portal gun in the Portal series.
If the player looks closely, the portals do not float in the air and are in fact slowly falling when spawned
This weapon can hit a 2x damage buff that is above where the weapon lands.

drone.desc:
Shoots a drone like the ones that spawn naturally. Once it reaches the peak of its arc, it selects a player at random, firing shots at them that ignore terrain and obstacles. The drone will only hit one enemy, even if two enemies or an enemy and a teammate are stacked.
If the drone hits terrain or a tank before activating, it will explode destroying terrain and dealing 10 damage.

content: As this weapon ignores all obstacles and terrain, it is best used to deal damage to someone hiding behind terrain or inside a location normally hard for a player to aim at.
This weapon is guaranteed to hit if not shot out of the map. This makes it the second easiest weapon to use, behind Earthquake.
The drone only activates once it reaches the apex of its trajectory.

You can deal self-damage if you shoot a drone at 0 90. This is because the shot will never reach its apex (it started the shot past its apex), so it will just drop on you and deal 10/20 self damage. To prevent this, literally just shoot 1 90 to instantly activate the drone.

If an enemy shoots a drone in a FFA, it is possible to tell whether or not its targeting you by the color of the drone's light. Green means you're safe, Red means you will get shot, even if the barrel of the drone is looking at a different tank.

heavy_drone.desc:
A stronger drone that packs a slightly harder punch.
Upon contact, this drone will explode dealing 20 damage.

content: As this weapon ignores all obstacles and terrain, it is best used to deal damage to someone hiding behind terrain or inside a location normally hard for a player to aim at.
This weapon is guaranteed to hit if not shot out of the map. This makes it the second easiest weapon to use, behind Earthquake.
The drone only activates once it reaches the apex of its trajectory.

You can deal self-damage if you shoot a drone at 0 90. This is because the shot will never reach its apex (it started the shot past its apex), so it will just drop on you and deal 10/20 self damage. To prevent this, literally just shoot 1 90 to instantly activate the drone.

If an enemy shoots a drone in a FFA, it is possible to tell whether or not its targeting you by the color of the drone's light. Green means you're safe, Red means you will get shot, even if the barrel of the drone is looking at a different tank.

volcano.desc: This weapon is not exactly what you might think it is. In fact, it's not. Volcano basically acts like a bulger, dealing the same 20 damage, but adds in fire particles that fly out from the top, dealing a little extra damage.

eruption.desc: The same as volcano, but adds in more fire.

throwing_star.desc: This weapon is exactly what it sounds like, although it does not do what you might think. Like what one might think, a throwing star is shot like a normal shot. Upon landing however, it does not deal damage. In fact, it rises in the air a bit, then shoots out 4 stars on both sides in a manner somewhat like carpet bomb, damaging enemies. Note: a miss with this weapon is REQUIRED in order to do damage, as the initial shot does not do any damage.

content: How to place a Ninja Star to maximize damage against a single target.

multi_star.desc: Same as throwing star, but shoots 5 stars on both sides, allowing more hits and potentially more damage output.

content: How to place a Ninja Star to maximize damage against a single target.

ninja.desc: Same as throwing star, but shoots 6 stars on both sides.

content: How to place a Ninja Star to maximize damage against a single target.

skeet.desc: For anyone who knows what skeet shooting is, they can definitely guess what this weapon does. Three clay pigeons are shot with a slight deviation in angle and power. After a skeet reaches the highest point of their arc, a bullet is shot at it in a straight line. It can be obstructed by land, but if it hits the pigeons it will break each of them into 7 shards that damages your enemy. Because the shards spread in a shotgun fashion, it is best to break the pigeons as close to the enemy as possible. It is recommended to use this weapon in a open area, as the terrain can block the bullets and cause the pigeons to not break. Damage is distance based.

content: The pigeons are fired from the end of the barrel, but the shots that break them are shot from the center of your tank. This means that sometimes the pigeons can be fired past obstacles, but the bullets will not.
The pigeons will break shortly after passing through the apex of their respective arcs, as long as there is no ground in-between them and your tank (straight line).
The bullets shot from the tank can bounce off of bumpers and travel through portals, but they can still break the pigeons without making actual contact.
Bullet shots can activate drones and damage buffs.
Activating a damage buff with a bullet will not award the +5XP trick shot bonus.
Bullets do not deal damage to enemies, even if they appear to hit them.

Since the pigeons only break after reaching the apex of their arc, the pigeons will not break if they are fired at an angle less than or equal to 0. If shot at this angle, the pigeons will not have an apex in their arc and thus they will not break.

olympic_skeet.desc: Similar to skeet, but shoots a red pigeon, a white pigeon, and a blue pigeon, each breaking into 9 shards after being shot. It tends to be better than skeet, although statistically identical.

content: The pigeons are fired from the end of the barrel, but the shots that break them are shot from the center of your tank. This means that sometimes the pigeons can be fired past obstacles, but the bullets will not.
The pigeons will break shortly after passing through the apex of their respective arcs, as long as there is no ground in-between them and your tank (straight line).
The bullets shot from the tank can bounce off of bumpers and travel through portals, but they can still break the pigeons without making actual contact.
Bullet shots can activate drones and damage buffs.
Activating a damage buff with a bullet will not award the +5XP trick shot bonus.
Bullets do not deal damage to enemies, even if they appear to hit them.

Since the pigeons only break after reaching the apex of their arc, the pigeons will not break if they are fired at an angle less than or equal to 0. If shot at this angle, the pigeons will not have an apex in their arc and thus they will not break.

tangent_fire.desc: A single shot is fired. Projectiles are rapidly spawned from it, tangent to the shot's arc. It is recommended to use this weapon with high angles, causing the spawned projectiles to land very close to the initial shot's landing spot.

tangent_attack.desc: Same as tangent fire, but spawns in "tangent line" projectiles at a faster rate.

tangent_assault.desc: This variant has the fastest spawning rate of all, allowing noticeably more damage to be done when shot at high angles.

summoner.desc: Summoner shoots a shot that seems to vanish into the ground. A moment later, small hovering projectiles will appear above the initial shot's landing spot, influenced by wind. The projectiles proceed to slam themselves into the ground, damaging anyone underneath. Because the projectiles have a bit of spread when spawning, it is advised to use this weapon against enemies on flat ground. Should the projectiles spawn inside a circle bumper, the results may or may not be good.

content: The projectiles spawned by this weapon are affected by wind. If there is high wind, you may need to land this weapon to the side of the tank.

mage.desc: Mage reduces the amount of damage done, but adds in noticeably more projectiles, increasing total damage done.

content: The projectiles spawned by this weapon are affected by wind. If there is high wind, you may need to land this weapon to the side of the tank.

travelers.desc: Travelers is an RNG weapon that is heavily reliant upon luck. Upon impact 5 yellow arrows split and travel in seemingly random directions. The arrows deal constant damage as long as they are on top of an enemy tank. Damage is distance based.

stats.Damage per Projectile: 2-8 per ingame tick over the AOE
stats.Self Damage: No, unless near the enemy tank

content: The spawned arrows will slow down slightly upon hitting an enemy.

The weapon's high reliance on randomness can cause it to do anything from 12 damage to 150+, with no way of predicting which it'll be. The closer the shot lands to the center of the enemy tank, the more likely it is to do large damage (due to the above bullet point).
Although an especially rare occasion, shooting this weapon in a circle bumper with an enemy in the middle can result in 300+ damage.

With a hit-rate of 10Hits/s and a duration of 8s, Scavengers can inflict up to 2000 damage on a single target. On seven players, with a Triple-Damage-Buff, All-Crit and Overcharge, this weapon can deal 105,000 damage in a single shot. This is the highest damage possible for a single shot in this game.

scavengers.desc: Scavengers is a more vicious version of travelers. After the 5 arrows split up and fly away, 5 more arrows appear, dealing even more damage. Those that are unfortunate enough to be at the edge of the map when hit by this weapon has a good chance of losing 100+ health.

stats.Damage per Projectile: 2-5 per ingame tick over the AOE
stats.Self Damage: No, unless near the enemy tank

content: The spawned arrows will slow down slightly upon hitting an enemy.

The weapon's high reliance on randomness can cause it to do anything from 12 damage to 150+, with no way of predicting which it'll be. The closer the shot lands to the center of the enemy tank, the more likely it is to do large damage (due to the above bullet point).
Although an especially rare occasion, shooting this weapon in a circle bumper with an enemy in the middle can result in 300+ damage.

jack_o_lantern.desc: Jack-o-lantern acts somewhat like a grenade and shrapnel at the same time. A glowing jack-o-lantern is shot and it will bounce around, leaving behind some fire at times. When it comes to a rest, it will explode, dealing damage. Seeds will also pop out, which deal additional damage.

content: Similar to Shrapnel and Shredders, when the Jack-o-Lantern and Jack-o-Vomit is placed at the bottom of the map, almost all projectiles released will collide with the indestructible ground layer. This causes heavy damage to enemy tanks.

Firing Jack-o-Lantern at the three-quarters mark between you and your destination on flatland at a high angle will allow you to land this right on the destination. (If you have the 100 power angle just lower your power to 86 or 87. This method is most effective when using an angle above 40 degrees and you are approximately the same elevation with your enemy.)

jack_o_vomit.desc: Similar to jack-o-lantern, but barfs out a volley of seeds sometime before exploding. When it vomits its seeds, the pumpkin's horizontal velocity will be reduced.

content: Similar to Shrapnel and Shredders, when the Jack-o-Lantern and Jack-o-Vomit is placed at the bottom of the map, almost all projectiles released will collide with the indestructible ground layer. This causes heavy damage to enemy tanks.

Firing Jack-o-Lantern at the three-quarters mark between you and your destination on flatland at a high angle will allow you to land this right on the destination. (If you have the 100 power angle just lower your power to 86 or 87. This method is most effective when using an angle above 40 degrees and you are approximately the same elevation with your enemy.)

wicked_witch.desc: Shoots a cackling witch that acts somewhat like a normal shot, but has an odd trajectory at times when shot. The witch does have a bit of AOE, meaning a slight miss can still hit. If the witch hits a bumper, there can be unexpected results, similar to the Spaz family.

content: Like most weapons, wicked witch follows a normal arc when shot. However, its arc is hidden and is not traced. Wicked witch will move about semi-randomly, however it will ultimately follow the path of this hidden arc, similarly to Spaz and Rocket Fire. This hidden arc is affected by portals, black holes, wind and round bumpers. Flat bumpers and side bumpers will not change the arc's trajectory.
Since the hidden arc is not affected by flat bumpers, wicked witch can be aimed straight through said bumpers. Video example provided.
The hidden arc can pass through the center of a black hole, but it can get held in there, leading the witch/brooms/ghouls to gravitate towards the black hole further.
The visible shots are never affected by black hole, as it always follows the hidden arc. However, it can still be swallowed by the black hole if it touches the center.
You will only receive trick shot XP bonuses, as well as activate buffs and drones, if one of the visible shots does a trick shot. Hidden arc is not considered.

The animation that plays when a shot goes off-screen is played for both when the hidden arc leaves the screen, as well as when a visible shot leaves the screen. Witch has a single hidden arc, while both brooms share an arc, as well as both ghouls; which can lead to extra animations being played.

witches_broom.desc: Along with the witch, two flying brooms are also shot. If all three projectiles hit, the total damage done will be more than its previous tier.

ghouls.desc: The complete Halloween set. Ghouls shoots the witch, the two brooms, and two ghosts. Significant damage can be dealt and because damage is not distance based, it may be better to use this weapon when you have a direct line of sight to your target at close range.

stats.Damage: 110 (44 per witch, 22 per ghosts, 11 per broom)

botherer.desc: Botherer will stop mid-air when it gets to \~43 PU away from an enemy tank, and  will proceed to rapidly spray 30 projectiles that deal 5 damage each. At very close range, it does 1 damage per projectile, otherwise it does 5 per projectile.

content: If you must shoot Botherer and its upgrades at a range it is best landed if your opponent is near a bumper or if the angle it targets the enemy tank at gives a possibility of hitting enemy tanks behind your opponent.
If the arc of this weapon passes too close to an enemy, it will lock on to them which can ruin its potential damage.

tormentor.desc: Tormentor stops at the same range as Botherer and will fire 40 projectiles in rapid succession that each deal 4 damage. At very close range, it does 1 damage per projectile, otherwise it does 4 per projectile.

content: If you must shoot Botherer and its upgrades at a range it is best landed if your opponent is near a bumper or if the angle it targets the enemy tank at gives a possibility of hitting enemy tanks behind your opponent.
If the arc of this weapon passes too close to an enemy, it will lock on to them which can ruin its potential damage.

punisher.desc: Punisher stops at the same range as Botherer and will rapidly fire 60 projectiles that each deal 3 damage. At very close range, it does 1 damage per projectile, otherwise it does 3 per projectile.

content: If you must shoot Botherer and its upgrades at a range it is best landed if your opponent is near a bumper or if the angle it targets the enemy tank at gives a possibility of hitting enemy tanks behind your opponent.
If the arc of this weapon passes too close to an enemy, it will lock on to them which can ruin its potential damage.

oddball.desc: Shoots a ball that poops out little green skulls, each dealing 10 damage. When it comes to a rest, it will explode, but its radius is that of a Snowball's. Deals 10 damage.

oddbomb.desc: The upgrade of our erratic friend, the Oddbomb! This version changes the skulls' color to orange, and having a bigger final explosion at the end of its life cycle. The final explosion does 40 damage.

permaroller.desc: A roller, but with a twist: It only does damage at the end of it's path (not when colliding with a tank), but does a lot more damage than a roller. From start to finish the permaroller should roll for 2 seconds

content: If you go to the Firing Range and click on the editor in the top left, you can see little squares that divide the map. Both Permaroller and Heavy Permaroller move at the same speed, which is about 2.33 small squares per second.

heavy_permaroller.desc: This Permaroller is slightly bigger in size and blast radius, rolls for about 1 second longer for a total roll time of 3 seconds, and does a bit more damage.

content: If you go to the Firing Range and click on the editor in the top left, you can see little squares that divide the map. Both Permaroller and Heavy Permaroller move at the same speed, which is about 2.33 small squares per second.

cropduster.desc: Throws a projectile resulting in a nauseous stench hitting your enemies.

noxiousduster.desc: Shoots an even worse smell with more damage and spread.

toxicduster.desc: Shoots the worst smell with more damage and spread.

small_potion.desc: Heals whoever is in the effect radius.

medium_potion.desc: Heals whoever is in the effect radius.

large_potion.desc: Heals whoever is in the effect radius.

huge_potion.desc: Heals whoever is in the effect radius.

health_aura.desc: Summons a healing circle around the user's tank, attaining to tank damage.

wanderer.desc: Fires a projectile that, upon landing, wanders around near to the landing location. After a few seconds, it creates a small explosion.

double_wanderer.desc: Just like its first tier, except it instead spawns two wanderer projectiles after landing!

triple_wanderer.desc: Just like the prior two tiers, except it spawns three projectiles!

censorbar.desc: Shoots a censored bar, doing a random amount of damage in intervals of 0-9 per hit.

restrictedbar.desc: Shoots a restricted bar doing random intervals of damage from 1-11 per hit.

redactedbar.desc: Shoots a redacted bar doing random intervals of damage from 1-13 per hit.

kiss.desc: A simple kiss, sucking the life from your enemy.

french_kiss.desc: Increases the damage dealt and the healing slightly.

smooch.desc: Increases both the damage and the healing even further.

confuser.desc: Confuses all tanks in range, causing them to shoot a projectile onto themselves. Works on allies, enemies, and dead tanks.

content: Like the Radar tree, weapon damage increases quadratically when players are stacked. Its damage formula on stacked players is the same as the one for the Radar tree: d = bt2, where d is total damage, b is base damage, and t is the number of players stacked on top of one another.
While the targets' turrets will be facing up, their shot alignment will be returned to their previous shot once the whole Confuser is done.

super_confuser.desc: Same as the previous tier, but packs a heavier punch in a larger area. Even more confusing.

content: Like the Radar tree, weapon damage increases quadratically when players are stacked. Its damage formula on stacked players is the same as the one for the Radar tree: d = bt2, where d is total damage, b is base damage, and t is the number of players stacked on top of one another.
While the targets' turrets will be facing up, their shot alignment will be returned to their previous shot once the whole Confuser is done.

mega_confuser.desc: The most confusing of them all. Packs an even heavier punch, making it a great choice against a stack.
